headline: Airtel , "Vikings" Idea raises international call rates.

description.details: Telecom major Airtel has increased international call rates by up to 80 per cent this month mainly due to the impact of depreciation in rupee. Another leading operator Idea has also hiked international call rates by up to 25 per cent, according to the company's website. As per the information available on the websites of two companies.

headline: US ship with arms detained at Tuticorin.

description.details: The Indian Coast Guard on Friday detained a vessel, belonging to a US-based firm, with 10 crew and 25 security guards on board off Kanyakumari coast. Semi-automatic weapons were found aboard the vessel, MV Seaman Guard. The crew, reportedly, did not have documents authorising them to carry these weapons.

headline: Sanjay Dutt applies for extension for leave.

description.details: Bollywood star Sanjay Dutt, who on October 1 was granted a leave of 14 days from Pune's Yerwada central prison, is likely to extend his stay at home in Mumbai by 14 days. The actor has applied for his leave to be extended for another two weeks under the provisions of the jail manual.

headline: Pawar @ Gadkari's function: 'Nobody untouchable in politics'.

description.details: In a function where former BJP president Nitin Gadkari rolled out business plan of his Purti Group, Sharad Pawar has said 'there are no untouchables in politic'. On the occasion, Gadkari declared a tie-up with Essar Group for launching 100 petrol pumps across the country to sell ethanol blended fuel. Purti makes ethanol through baggase and other bio-waste.

headline: Raghuram Rajan is not a Superman.

description.details: RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan, who has increasingly been portrayed as a ‘rock star’ after occupying the current position, both in the national and international media, has said that he is ‘not a superman’. ‘Expectations are high. Clearly I am not a superman. There is a little bit of euphoria in India,’ Mr Rajan told a Washington audience yesterday at an event organised.
